entry.title: Continuous deployment of a Flask server with Github Actions

link.title: Continuous deployment of a Flask server with Github Actions

entry.summary: In my previous post I covered how to setup an AWS EC2 instance with a bare bones Flask project. At the end of the post we automated this by using Ansible. In this post, we take it one step further and let Github use Ansible to provision and configure our EC2 instance. If you haven’t read the last post, I recommend at least skimming through it to get an idea of what we’re setting up here.
